info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Florence, southwestern Dillon, northwestern Marion and south central Marlboro Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Blue Brick, or near Marion, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rainfall and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may result in brief localized flooding and ponding. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes may become continuous during the peak of this storm. Locations impacted include... Latta, Sellers, Blue Brick, Mars Bluff, Brownsville, Oak Grove, Francis Marion University and Floydale. This includes Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 171 and 186. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
